intro: Cleidion ramosii, commonly known as the tropical ash tree, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in lowland rainforests and thrives in humid, tropical climates. The bark and leaves of Cleidion ramosii have been used in traditional medicine for their potential therapeutic properties.
